summary:
Leading and contributing to KITs programs and assignments, always with an entrepreneurial, pragmatic and results-driven mindset. More than 10 years experience in designing and implementing sustainability strategies, achieving systemic and farm level impact, and improving the fairness and effectiveness of agricultural value chains. A passion for coffee and cocoa, especially in the specialty and fine flavor sectors, but leveraging the insights of professional service delivery models of KIT's clients, large private multinationals.

Among many other roles at KIT: worked on solving complex challenges and transforming the South Sudanese seed sector, in a 4 year program, together with the amazing A3-SEED team; co-led the inclusion and empowerment teams of HortiNigeria, a 10 million euro program of the Dutch Embassy in Nigeria; provided strategic leadership to KIT's living income focus area, shaping our team and services; used KIT's own funding to research smallholder farmers' participation in climate mitigation, and inclusive business models.

Vast experience in East Africa and South America.  

In previous jobs, led the development and application of digital farm management systems and blockchain traceability apps for access to finance and markets. 

Lead author of impact reports; evaluations and living income gap studies; research papers on topics such as investments in agribusiness in fragile states, and blockchain use cases in agriculture.

[{'company': {'id': 45241, 'name': 'KIT Royal Tropical Institute', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQHQjpS_n-4srA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856687182?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=n_NB-gLUApORsklhAPCX0_VaOjpdGwwilj8XjMCy9vA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/royal-tropical-institute/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'KIT Royal Tropical Institute', 'description': 'Leading Seed and Policy sector assessments in Ethiopia to monitor the outcomes of the Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa (AGRA), as well as the SME survey development and implementation for AGRA to monitor outcomes in 11 Sub-Saharan countries. 

Leading the evaluation of the Cocoa Origins Program of IDH, which funded eight innovative partnerships of cocoa producers, buyers and users, to promote cooperation in six key countries of origin and to contribute to the Dutch target of 100% sustainable cocoa consumption by 2025. 

Co-lead the design of a Youth & Gender inclusion and entrepreneurship strategy for a EUR 10 mil. project in South Sudan (A3-SEED), supporting the Dutch Embassy and IFDC on building business models for young entrepreneurs in selected value chains.

Co-lead the design of a Youth and Gender empowerment strategy for HortiNigeria (EUR 5 mil. project) and implementing activities which target 480 women and 600 young farmers, 500 employees and 50 SMEs. 

Income gap study for Trabocca’s smallholder coffee suppliers in the Guji Zone, Ethiopia. Led the study which included a survey of 200 household heads, interviewing supply chain partners, mapping the service delivery model of Trabocca in Ethiopia and writing the report and recommendations for closing the gap between actual incomes and a living income benchmark. 

Study on value chain approaches for social change, for Oxfam. 

Formulating recommendations for the Africa Agriculture and Trade Investment Fund (AATIF) to support smallholder farmers in response to COVID-19, in Ivory Coast (cocoa & cashew), Kenya (dairy) and Zambia (maize, wheat, sunflower, soybeans, cotton). 

Evaluation of the Kenyan programmes national plant health system (Plantwise and Action on Invasives), to inform the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs in designing a new global flagship programme ‘Plantwise Plus’.

Have led the M&E team and developed the monitoring plan and tools. Designed a Living Income Roadmap for 500 farming families. Conducted living income studies and various surveys and data analyses. 

Led funding proposal development and obtained donor funds (SDGP, GIZ, MinBuZa, etc.). Led reporting activities. Co-wrote the Impact Reports 2018 and 2019 for Moyee Coffee and FairChain Foundation's various white papers. 

Participated in the development of blockchain  solutions and use cases for traceability, trade, digital farm management, impact measurement. Led pilots in Ethiopia (coffee), and in Ecuador's cacao value chain as implementing partner of UNDP. Services include: graphical and textual representations of theories of change, practical impact measurement plans, data collection and analysis; as well as communications services: creating annual reports, impact dashboards or online and offline campaigns to change consumer behavior through nudging.
